RACE.RACE_TEXT: ARAPAHOE PARK RACE 1 350 Y Dirt CR: 76. Allowance Purse 9500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD NON WINNERS OF THREE RACES LIFETIME. Three Year Olds, 124 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SKYSTHALIMITCARVER dueled, prevailed. POSSIBILITEASE dueled, out kicked. XCELENTE drifted out throughout. PAINT YOUR FACE BLUE late effort. TRUE dueled, outfinished. NO TORIOUS no impact.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: ARAPAHOE PARK RACE 2 300 Y Dirt CR: 64. Maiden Purse 6300. FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TDS QUARTER MOON strong debut, hand ridden. TRUMMPY steady drive. INTEREST IN UR EYES stumbled to knees, dueled, game third. AZOOMN BYE dueled, outfinished. CHICKASWAY fractious gate, bumped midway. MONTE CRISTO YAYA bumped midway. STREAKIN WITH STOLI no threat. JBA HOME GROWN awkward start, veered in midway.

ENTRY.NAME: Interest in Ur Eyes
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled to knees, dueled, game third

RACE.RACE_TEXT: ARAPAHOE PARK RACE 3 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 59. Claiming Purse 5000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD NON WINNERS OF A RACE IN 2023 OR NON WINNERS OF FOUR RACES LIFETIME. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $2,500. Colorado Bred Claiming Price $3,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LIL MISS DE BUY was off the pace to the turn then tipped in to save ground around the turn but lacked room at the quarter pole then moved out to five wide in upper stretch and drove past the leaders late. EYEJUST TOOKCHARGE trailed the field early, made a four wide bid at the half mile marker and kept on around the turn, fought gamely down the stretch to prove second best. DONNAS FINAL WORD stalked the pace down the backstretch then made a three wide bid around the turn to take the lead at the eighth pole but was outfinished. LADY PHYLLIS tracked the leaders to the turn then moved up from three or four wide on the turn to improve position. MY MEADOW rushed up the rail to take a pressured lead to the three furlong marker then vied for the lead to the top of the stretch and weakened. OUT OF THE SKY vied for the lead from the two path to the three furlong marker then took over but was eclipse at the three sixteenth pole and gave way. A STEWARDS INQUIRY WAS POSTED INTO THE RUNNING NEAR THE QUARTER POLE, AFTER A REVIEW NO ACTION WAS TAKEN.

ENTRY.NAME: My Meadow
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed up, pressured lead, vied inside, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Out of the Sky
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead, led 3/8, eclipsed 3/16, gave way,

ENTRY.NAME: Lil Miss de Buy
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, saved ground turn, lacked room1/4, 5wupper, drove past

RACE.RACE_TEXT: ARAPAHOE PARK RACE 4 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 6600. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD NON WINNERS OF THREE RACES LIFETIME OR COLORADO BRED NON WINNERS OF FOUR RACES LIFETIME. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000. Colorado Bred Claiming Price $6,250.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RIGHT ON TIME was close up on the pace while racing four wide throughout, made a late stretch run to clear the leader in the final yards to prevail. TOO LATE vied for the lead from three wide, made a bid around the turn to take command at the quarter pole but was collared in the final furlong and was a clear second. HONKY TONK MUSIC trailed the field to the quarter pole then made a late rail rally to be up for the show. THOUGHTS OF GOLD was off the pace in the two path then made a three wide bid on the turn from between horses but failed to sustain that bid. ORDER OF THE DAY raced near the back and passed tiring rival. DEL ARGENT saved ground to no avail. LEFT THE BAR sprinted to the lead from the inside but was headed at the five sixteenths pole and kept on, tired in early stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Honky Tonk Music
ENTRY.OWNER: Di Filippo Jo Ann and Tate Mary

ENTRY.NAME: Thoughts of Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 3wbid turn, failed to sustain bid,

ENTRY.NAME: Too Late
ENTRY.OWNER: Rushton Stacey Eskew Stuart and Alfrey Vance
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead, bid turn, command 1/4, collared, clear 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Right On Time
ENTRY.COMMENT: close up, 4wtrip, late run, cleared late, prevailed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: ARAPAHOE PARK RACE 5 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 66. Claiming Purse 6400. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD NON WINNERS OF TWO RACES LIFETIME OR COLORADO BRED NON WINNERS OF THREE RACES LIFETIME. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000. Colorado Bred Claiming Price $6,250.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ANGIE'S REVRAC stalked the pace down the backstretch then made a three wide bid at the three furlong marker and took the lead at the three sixteenths pole and drew clear. AMY D co-led from the two path to the half mile marker then settled off the pace on the turn, moved between horses at the quarter pole and proved second best. MAKARA co-led from off the rail to the half mile marker then inched away around the turn but was headed at the quarter pole and fought gamely in the early stretch and weakened. SMOKIN AMELIA was off slow, trailed the field while saving ground through the turn but kept on to improve her position in the stretch. RETRO RITA prompted the pace on the backstretch then floated out going into the turn and was not a threat. BONITA DIXIE chased the leaders down the backstretch then saved ground around the turn and tired late.

ENTRY.NAME: Makara
ENTRY.COMMENT: co-led off rail, inch away, headed 1/4, gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Retro Rita
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompt pace, float out turn, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Amy D
ENTRY.COMMENT: co-led 2w, settled off pace, between 1/4, second best,

ENTRY.NAME: Bonita Dixie
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased leaders, saved ground turn, tired late

ENTRY.NAME: Smokin Amelia
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, saved ground turn, improved

RACE.RACE_TEXT: ARAPAHOE PARK RACE 6 1M Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 5000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD NON WINNERS TWO RACES IN 2023 OR NON WINNERS OF FOUR RACES LIFETIME. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $2,500. Colorado Bred Claiming Price $3,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HAPPY HAPPY HAPPY raced in the middle of the pack down the backstretch then made a three wide bid at the five sixteenths pole to take the lead at the top of the stretch and held off late closer to prevail. PROMPTLY DONE was allowed to settle in the middle of the pack down the backstretch then saved ground around the final turn, tipped out to four wide in upper stretch for a late rally but was not enough. GEORGIANO pressed the pace from the two path then took the lead at the three furlong marker but was collard at the top of the stretch and was outfinished. HOT LIL MESS raced near the back through the final turn and passed tiring rivals. LA ROSA DRIVE went to the front to a pressured lead from the inside, held that position to the seven sixteenths pole then vied for the lead around the final turn and gave way in early stretch. STARLIGHT TWIST trailed the field through the final turn but was outrun. AUNT IRENE raced in the middle of the pack to midway through the final turn and dropped back.

ENTRY.NAME: Happy Happy Happy
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, 3w5/16, took lead, held on, prevailed

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Hargus & Sandra Sexton and Silver FernFarm

ENTRY.NAME: Starlight Twist
ENTRY.OWNER: Miller Hannah and Haar Robert J

ENTRY.NAME: La Rosa Drive
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressured lead, vied 2nd turn, gave way,

ENTRY.NAME: Promptly Done
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, middle of pack, 4wupper, late rally,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: ARAPAHOE PARK RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 73. Claiming Purse 7200. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD NON WINNERS OF TWO RACES LIFETIME. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000. Colorado Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DOCS CARO CAT went to the front to set a pressured pace for a half then pulled away at the top of the stretch and held on. BORN TO RACE raced near the back early, steadily advanced from five wide, made a late run in the stretch but was not enough. GO LAKER GO raced off the pace from three wide but lacked the late response. CRYSTAL BANDIT had no speed on the backstretch then moved up from three wide on the turn angled out to five wide in upper stretch for a late rally. TREASURE COAST raced near the back early the steadily advanced from four wide on the turn but finished evenly. ROCHESTER'S FINEST vied for the lead from two wide to the quarter pole and gave way. BRAVO KOLT vied for the early lead from the two path to the five furlong marker and retreated. TEQUILA was forwardly placed to the seven sixteenths pole and fell back. CHARLIE'S NO SAINT raced in the middle of the pack to the five furlong marker then dropped back.

ENTRY.NAME: Docs Caro Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: led, set pace, pulled away, held on

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Dwain W. Eaton & Donna J. Eaton

ENTRY.NAME: Treasure Coast
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, steady advance, finish evenly

ENTRY.NAME: Born to Race
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, steady advance, late run, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Rochester's Finest
ENTRY.OWNER: Rust Terri and Barton Ranch Stables LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: ARAPAHOE PARK RACE 8 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 5800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD NON WINNERS OF TWO RACES LIFETIME. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $3,500. Colorado Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CAJUN FIRE sprinted away to an unchallenged lead and drew off in the stretch. SECRET SURVIVOR raced in the middle of the pack to the turn then fell back and made a five wide rally but was no match for the winner. UNSTOPPABLE ME raced in the middle of the pack to the turn then moved up from two or three wide around the turn, kept on to be up for the show. DEACON BEACON tracked the leaders from three wide through the turn but lacked a late responsed. CHICKEN N BISCUIT raced near the back to the turn then moved up from three wide and flattened out. ENDALE ARCH raced in the middle of the pack on the inside through the turn then angled out and drifted out to mid track in the early stretch but made a rally. REAL POUCH prompted the pace to the quarter pole and tired. BIGPARTY NOWHISKEY raced near the back and was not a threat. BARTSTER reared as the gates opened then trailed the field and passed tiring rivals. BURBACH raced off the pace to the quarter pole and retreated. KATRAKA was forwardly placed on the inside to the three furlong marker and gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Secret Survivor
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, fell back turn, 5wrally

ENTRY.NAME: Endale Arch
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, drifted out, mid track rally

ENTRY.NAME: Bartster
ENTRY.COMMENT: reared start, trailed, passed tiring rivals,
